articles.author: Alasdair Pal
articles.description: An Australian woman accused of murdering three elderly relatives of her estranged husband using a meal laced with toxic mushrooms had no motive to kill them, her lawyer told the court on Tuesday as the defence began its closing argument.
articles.title: Australian accused of mushroom murders had no reason to kill, court hears

articles.author: Alexander Cornwell, Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Israel and Iran attacked each other for a fifth straight day on Tuesday, and U.S. President Donald Trump urged Iranians to evacuate Tehran, citing what he said was the country's rejection of a deal to curb nuclear weapons development.
articles.title: Trump urges Tehran evacuation as Iran-Israel conflict enters fifth day

articles.author: David Ljunggren, John Irish, Andreas Rinke
articles.description: Leaders from the Group of Seven nations began annual talks on Monday with wars in Ukraine and the Middle East adding to global economic uncertainty, as host Canada tries to avoid a clash with U.S. President Donald Trump.
articles.title: G7 leaders aim for unity, facing escalating wars in Ukraine, Middle East

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: The Group of Seven nations expressed support for Israel in a statement issued late on Monday and labeled its rival Iran as a source of instability in the Middle East, with the G7 leaders urging broader de-escalation of hostilities in the region.
articles.title: G7 expresses support for Israel, calls Iran source of instability

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Waves of Russian drones and missiles struck districts across the Ukrainian capital Kyiv early on Tuesday, damaging an apartment building, sparking fires and injuring up to 16 people, city officials said.
articles.title: Russia attacks Kyiv with waves of drones, missiles

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump and British Prime Minister Keir Starmer said on Monday they had finalized a trade deal reached between the two allies last month.
articles.title: Trump signs proclamation to implement US-UK trade deal, Starmer calls it 'sign of strength'

articles.author: Jason Lange
articles.description: President Donald Trump's public approval rating held steady over the last month, but Americans are becoming less supportive of his approach to immigration as his administration cracks down, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll that closed on Monday.
articles.title: Trump approval steady at 42%, support weakens for his immigration policy, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds

articles.author: Nathan Layne
articles.description: A man accused of killing a Democratic state lawmaker while posing as a police officer is expected to appear in a Minnesota court on Monday afternoon on state murder charges, after a massive two-day manhunt ended with his arrest on Sunday night.
articles.title: Suspect in Minnesota lawmaker killing to appear in court on murder charges

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. Department of Homeland Security on Monday told staff it was reversing guidance issued last week that agents were not to conduct immigration raids at farms, hotels and restaurants, the Washington Post reported late on Monday.
articles.title: US reverses guidance pausing ICE raids on farms, hotels and restaurants, WaPo reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A U.S. citizen died during an overnight air attack on Ukraine's capital, Kyiv, the city's mayor said early on Tuesday.
articles.title: US citizen dies in Russian attack on Ukraine capital, Kyiv mayor says
